玧字的基本解释

玧
mén
古同“璊”。

玧
yǔn
古代贵族冠冕两旁悬挂的玉，用来塞耳。

玧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mén］
［《集韻》謨奔切，平魂，明。］
同“璊1”。
[②]［yǔn］
［《廣韻》余準切，上準，以。］
古代少数民族冠冕两旁悬挂的玉，用以塞耳。

玧字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　玧； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页728第13
【廣韻】余準切【集韻】庾準切，?音尹。充耳玉。【集韻】瑱也。　又【集韻】余專切，音沿。玧珸，蠻夷充耳。　又謨奔切，音門。玉赤色也。與璊同。

玧字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
玧字的起名意思

指赤色的玉璊或古代贵族冠冕两旁悬挂的玉。

玧
Basic explanation of words
玧
mén
Gu Tong "rewarded".
玧
yǔn
The jade hanging on both sides of the ancient noble crown was used to plug the ears.
玧
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mén］
["Ji Yun" Mo Benqie, Ping Hun, Ming. ]
Same as "Reward 1".
[②]［yǔn］
["Guang Yun" Yu Zhun cut, on the standard, to. ]
The jade hanging on both sides of the ancient minority crowns was used to plug the ears.
玧
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Jade Character Department] 　玧; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 728 13
[Guang Yun] Yu Zhunqie [Jiyun] Yu Zhunqie, Yin Yin. Deaf ears. 【Ji Yun】Liao Ye.　 [Ji Yun] Yu Zhuan cut, sound along. Binjue, savage deaf ears.　You Mo Benqie, sound door. Jade red color is also. Same with reward.

玧
Name meaning
Refers to the red jade decoration or the jade hanging on both sides of the ancient noble crown.
